an4.167:4.1: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna,
an4.167:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāriputta sat down to one side
an4.167:5.1: “Reverend Moggallāna, there are four ways of practice.
an4.167:5.3: ~Painful practice with slow insight, ~painful practice with swift insight, ~pleasant practice with slow insight, and ~pleasant practice with swift insight.
an4.167:5.4: These are the four ways of practice.
an4.167:5.5: Which one of these four ways of practice did you rely on to free your mind from defilements without grasping?”
an4.167:6.5: I relied on the painful practice with swift insight to free my mind from defilements without grasping.”
